sections.title: Stats
sections.content:
Strength (STR) - Equipment requirements mostly
Toughness (TOG) - only put 10 points into for Salty Bone Bracers or leave it at starting amount at invest into agility or focus
Agility (AGI) - Equipment requirements mostly
Focus (FOC) - Minimum of 20 to 30.

By 100 you can have 160 strength, 20 toughness, 100 agility and 22 focus. Alternatively, drop 10 str and put it into agility or focus probably best putting it into focus to improve regen rate, overall mana, proc chance and keeping effectiveness of spells at 100%. Also by getting EAs you can improve these further. You can also leave toughness at its starting number of 10 to put those 10 points into focus or even agility.

alternative.note: Drop 10 str and put it into focus to improve regen rate, overall mana, proc chance and keeping effectiveness of spells at 100%

sections.title: Skills
sections.content: Every melee Ranger should max these skills

skills.name: Swords
skills.description: Max this ASAP needed to kill mobs faster and do more damage.

skills.name: Dodge
skills.description: A MUST helps to stay alive longer.

skills.name: Parry
skills.description: Handy to have, if not dodging you will parry most of the time.

skills.name: Dual Wield
skills.description: Max this ASAP. Improves off hand damage.

skills.name: Triple Attack
skills.description: Increases chance of hitting 3 times. Can be left to AA.

skills.name: Rapid Attack
skills.description: Adds 3% haste per point. Can be left to AA.

skills.name: Critical Hit
skills.description: Improves chance of doing double damage to a mob.

skills.name: Rampage
skills.description: Adds between 30 and 60 damage per point in it.

skills.name: Mastery of Pain
skills.description: Improves damage absorb by 2% per point invested.

skills.name: Stealth
skills.description: Handy to have, adds to dodge as well (0.5% per point). AA this, unless you want to try and PK or avoid getting killed in a guild war.

skills.name: Evade
skills.description: Improves dodge 5% per point but only lasts for 20 seconds and takes 2 minutes to recharge. AA this, unless you really want to max as soon as you get it.

sections.notes: From memory I had worked it out to between 20 and 30 AAs to have ALL melee skills maxed.

sections.title: Spells
sections.content: Depending on how you go about maxing your self buffs, you can max one line which is AWN -> SWN -> OWN or even them out and AA both to max.
sections.recommendations: You really only have one choice at the beginning of which self buff to train up and that is Spirit of the Wolf at level 25. You can max the Spirit of the Wolf line first and AA Attenuation With Nature line or vice versa. Around 8 AAs to finish off self buff (Str/Tog or Dmg/Haste line).

sections.title: Equipment
sections.content: By Level 100 you should try to have all this equip (that is if you can afford to buy it all). If you cannot afford it there are other items you can use instead, until you can afford them or win them on a boss run.

weapons: Barbarian Greatsword and Blade of VanGosel
Frost Bourne Ice Axe and Blade of VanGosel
Ancient Lizardfolk Blade and Naraikos Sword
Frostwraith and BD or combo of other swords mentioned

sections.notes: Items like Crown of Light, Timeless Sedgeway Family Seal, and Shadow Bound Ring are quest items that can only be obtained and completed when you reach 100. You will need to win the other items on boss runs (which comes down to luck and the other ppl rolling lower than you), or buy them from other players or the bazaar.
